Package com.iontrading.mkv.qos

Class MkvQoS

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iontrading.mkv.qos.MkvQoS
  • @Keep
@KeepPublicClassMemberNames
public class MkvQoS
extends Object
    A configuration class for the API.

    This class contains a set of properties which can be used at construction time by the Mkv class.

    Some properties overrides global ones. Others are Java specific and can be set only using this class.

    See Also:
    Mkv

      • addGlobalEventListenerFactory

        public void addGlobalEventListenerFactory​(GlobalEventListenerFactory factory)
        Adds a GlobalEventListenerFactory. This factory will be used by engine to create object at an appropriate time, this object will be notified for all global events
        Parameters:
        factory - The factory object

      • setAutoRegister

        public void setAutoRegister​(boolean autoRegister)
        Sets the autoRegister attribute.
        Parameters:
        autoRegister - If true the component automatically tries to register with the platform when it is started through the Mkv.start() methods, otherwise it tries to register when the MkvPlatform.register() method is explicitly invoked.

      • setLoadInit

        public void setLoadInit​(boolean loadInit)
        Sets the loadInit attribute.
        Parameters:
        loadInit - If true the component automatically tries to load the file specified using the '-init' command-line option.

      • setAutoShutdownHook

        public void setAutoShutdownHook​(boolean autoShutdownHook)
        Sets the autoShutdownHook attribute.
        Parameters:
        autoShutdownHook - If true this API automatically registers a ShutdownHook with the Java Virtual Machine. This ShutdownHook tries to safely shutdown this API when the System.exit() method is invoked. If false no ShutdownHook is registered.

      • setRoutingOnRequest

        public void setRoutingOnRequest​(boolean routingOnRequest)
        Sets the routingOnRequest attribute.
        Parameters:
        routingOnRequest - true if you want to enable routing.

      • setCheckMemoryThresholds

        public void setCheckMemoryThresholds​(boolean checkMemoryThresholds)
        Sets the checkMemoryThresholds attribute.
        Parameters:
        checkMemoryThresholds - If true this API automatically registers a memory checker with the Java Virtual Machine. This memory checker raises platform warning and errors when certain memory usage thresholds are exceeded

      • setPublisherUsesDateTimeObjects

        public void setPublisherUsesDateTimeObjects​(boolean flag)
        Enables the use of MkvValueDate and MkvValueTime when the publisher receives a call to an ION Bus Function. If the ION Bus Function is defined to take Date or Time parameters, the corresponding value provided on the onCall stack will be an MkvValueDate or MkvValueTime object.
        Parameters:
        flag - true if MkvFunctionListener::onCall shall be invoked using MkvValueDate or MkvValueTime objects instead of plain integers.

      • getPublisherUsesDateTimeObjects

        public boolean getPublisherUsesDateTimeObjects()
        Returns whether this component supports the use of MkvValueDate and MkvValueTime when it receives a call to an ION Bus Function. If the ION Bus Function is defined to take Date or Time parameters, the corresponding value provided on the onCall stack will be an MkvValueDate or MkvValueTime object.
        Returns:
        the flag configured via setPublisherUsesDateTimeObjects(boolean)

        Override the default value of an MkvProperty This method needs to be called before starting the Java API
        Parameters:

        newDefault - the new default value

      • linkPropertyValues

        public void linkPropertyValues​(String settingName,
                               String referencedSettingName)
        Override the default value of an MkvProperty, linking it to the value of another MkvProperty This method needs to be called before starting the Java API
        Parameters:
        settingName - the name of the MkvProperty to override
        referencedSettingName - the referenced MkvProperty to rely on, in case 'settingName' has no configured value
